title: Krishna Wants Our Uninterrupted Attention | Soulful Japa
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Maharaj

segments.key_quote: Let me connect this uninterrupted chanting to Bhakti.
segments.summary: The lecture begins by connecting uninterrupted chanting to Bhakti, referencing a fire example.

segments.key_quote: Whether I chant 108 mantras in 108 minutes or in seven minutes, how does it matter?
segments.summary: The speaker questions whether the speed of chanting matters to Krishna, suggesting that the number of mantras chanted shouldn't be the only factor.

segments.key_quote: Krishna wants, what are we doing in our japa? We are offering something very fundamental to us. What is that? Attention.
segments.summary: The speaker explains that Krishna desires our attention during japa, comparing uninterrupted attention to the greater love of a devoted lover.

segments.key_quote: Krishna wants the essence of all Krishna consciousness is always remember Krishna, never forget him.
segments.summary: The speaker emphasizes the importance of concurrent chanting and hearing, highlighting that the essence of Krishna consciousness is to always remember Krishna.

segments.key_quote: Two hours of 16 rounds is a great opportunity for rehearsal of uninterrupted japa, constant chanting of Hare Krishna Maha Mantra without a break.
segments.summary: The speaker suggests that chanting 16 rounds for two hours is a rehearsal for uninterrupted japa.

segments.key_quote: Definitely, an uninterrupted japa means you are devoting your attention exclusively for him, not allowing anybody, anything else to take your attention away.
segments.summary: The speaker reiterates that uninterrupted japa means giving exclusive attention to Krishna, preventing distractions.

segments.key_quote: Lord is definitely pleased more and therefore if he's pleased more, therefore you see more energy, more heat flows into you.
segments.summary: The speaker connects devotion to increased energy and mercy, emphasizing the power of chanting and hearing Krishna's name.

segments.key_quote: So this is like a rehearsal for us. The chanting 16 rounds uninterruptedly.
segments.summary: The speaker concludes by stating that chanting 16 rounds uninterruptedly is a rehearsal, and that the mantra is for the lotus flower to be lit.
